EEL3021 - Introduction to Applied Random.name: EEL3021 - Introduction to Applied Randomness for Engineers

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2312 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better. Restricted to students from College of Engineering and Computer Science only.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Axioms of probability, conditional probability, independence, law of total probability, random variables, probability distributions and density functions, second order statistics, joint distributions, random vectors, limit theorems, transformations of random variables.

College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

The course includes recitation and exploration of areas of study within electrical and computer engineering. Open to Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering and Photonic Science and Engineering students only.
